You are my wife, you Due to my love and affection for you, and because you also have great faith in me, and because I have a desire to give you some real estate, I have inherited the property described in the 3rd paragraph of the schedule below and have been entitled to it up to this day, including the garden premises worth Rs. 6,48,000/- in characters, six lakhs and forty-eight thousand rupees, and I consider it a gift, and I give it to you without any compensation, that is, free of charge, and I immediately take possession of this property. You shall take possession. Therefore, you are the full rightful owner of the said settlement property and exercise all the powers and duties, and you shall pay the taxes, etc. of the Sri Panchayat in your name and you shall give it to your son, grandson, descendants, You shall enjoy the said settlement property with all rights, interests, and privileges for ever and ever, and shall enjoy it freely and freely as you please. Neither you nor your heirs nor we nor our heirs shall ever have any dispute about this. That the said settlement property has not been mortgaged, sold, agreed upon or otherwise transferred to any other person, that it is an undisputed property, that the said settlement property does not belong to the Government, any Government subsidiary, any mortgage security or undertaking or agency, any endowment or Wharf Board. That this property is not an assigned property, and that with my consent, this settlement deed is written in your name Given.
III.Schedule:- Srikakulam D., Padanur Sub.D., Etcherla Mandal, Etcherla Grama Panchayat, Etcherla Grama Revenue Enumeration Survey. No.6-15, in Etcherla Village, on the southern side of Rajamarga C.C. Road, having Door No.2-88, Asst.No.198, paying an annual tax of Rs.138/-, details of measurements of the terraced house premises:-
For the height:-11.5 feet or 3.496 meters,
For the area:- 40.75 feet or 12.388 meters i.e. 52.06 sq.m. or 43.470 sq.m. This settlement deed is hereby granted to you for the above mentioned terraced house premises measuring 11.5x40.75–468.625 sq.ft. and bounded by:- North:- Panchayat C.C. Road South:- Panchayat C.C. Road East:- Teeti Rama Rao Garu's terraced house West:- Inupa Durga Rao Garu's vacant land.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 521 of 2020, dated 07/Feb/2020, executed by Nedigintla Venkataramana in favour of his wife Nidigantla laxmi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 52.06 Sq.Yds, bearing house number 2-88, comprised in survey number 6-15, assessment number 198, situated in Etcherla Village and Grama Panchayath and Mandal, within the District of Srikakulam registered at sub-registrar office Ponduru is bounded as follows: North by: Panchayat C.C. road South by:Panchayat C.C. road East by: Rcc house of Theeti Ramarao West by: Vacant site of Inapa Durgarao

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
